intro: Rapanea ligustrina, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. The fruit is a small, dark berry that contains seeds, contributing to its ecological role in seed dispersal.
